bug.author: jonhull
bug.description:
I installed the beta (5.0b1) following the instructions from this project. When I try to run the line: import turicreate as tc I get the following error: <denchmark-code>> --------------------------------------------------------------------------- ImportError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-1-5e19a42750e5> in <module>() ----> 1 import turicreate as tc
/Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/__init__.py in <module>() 17 from turicreate.version_info import __version__ 18 ---> 19 from turicreate.data_structures.sgraph import Vertex, Edge 20 from turicreate.data_structures.sgraph import SGraph 21 from turicreate.data_structures.sarray import SArray
/Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/data_structures/__init__.py in <module>() 16 17 from . import image ---> 18 from . import sframe 19 from . import sarray 20 from . import sgraph
/Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/data_structures/sframe.py in <module>() 14 from __future__ import division as _ 15 from __future__ import absolute_import as _ ---> 16 from ..connect import main as glconnect 17 from ..cython.cy_flexible_type import infer_type_of_list 18 from ..cython.context import debug_trace as cython_context
/Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/connect/main.py in <module>() 11 from __future__ import absolute_import as _ 12 ---> 13 from ..cython.cy_unity import UnityGlobalProxy 14 from ..cython.cy_server import EmbeddedServer 15
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/cython/cy_unity.so, 2): Symbol not found: _syslog$DARWIN_EXTSN Referenced from: /Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/cython/../libunity_shared.dylib Expected in: /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib in /Users/jon/Projects/Stylize/turiEnv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/cython/../libunity_shared.dylib </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: I should also mention that I created a new virtual environment and reinstalled everything again, and still end up with the same issue...

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jonhull>@jonhull</denchmark-link> What version of XCode and MacOS are you on? Seems there is something off there. If you are having issues with system python, I'd recommend giving Miniconda (<denchmark-link:https://conda.io/miniconda.html>https://conda.io/miniconda.html</denchmark-link> ) a spin.

Error message is partially the same as in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/256>#256</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-link:https://github.com/znation>@znation</denchmark-link> What was the fix then?
I am on MacOS 10.12.6 at the moment. Xcode is version 9.2, which is the most recent app store version. I also have the Xcode 10 beta downloaded, but I haven't installed it yet...

I think the issue here is that 5.0b1 seems to have broken compatibility with macOS 10.12 - the symbol is not found. Other issues of this type (on other projects) tend to show the message <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mattrajca/sudo-touchid/issues/26>built for Mac OS X 10.13</denchmark-link> , but I'm not sure why that text doesn't appear here. I'll retitle the issue to reflect that.
I updated to 10.13.5 and it is working now, so it does seem to be an issue with 10.12.

Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/znation>@znation</denchmark-link>
I am also facing the same issue as I am running code on getting the same import error.
Mac OS version ---> . Python version ---> Is there a way I can use the turicreate 5.0 (Beta) on my machine?

I tracked it down: looks like libcrypto.a from OpenSSL is built for 10.14 by default now (and happens to still work on 10.13): <denchmark-code>./ssl/libcrypto.a U _syslog$DARWIN_EXTSN </denchmark-code>
The fix should be to specify macosx-min-version on that library. Let me see if that works.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nickjong>@nickjong</denchmark-link> Assigning to you per our discussion.
